revised_title: Peroxyde Formation and Reactions of Organic Acids
tldr: The author discusses the synthesis and properties of various peroxides of organic acids, including benzoyl, acetyl, nitro-benzoyl, cumenyl, butyl, and valeryl. They also investigate the reaction of barium peroxide with bibasic anhydrides, which have powerful oxidizing properties. The organic peroxides represent a new group of chemical substances with unique reactions, expanding our understanding of organic compounds and their analogies to inorganic substances.
